runs.comm: and West Indies supremely sloppy first ball. A length ball, outswinger, pushed through the vacant mid-on region, but Benn and Holder don't chase the ball. Embarrassingly the ball holds up near the boundary only to trickle over by the time the two big men reach there
another outswinger, left alone outside off

Samuels has dropped it. A poor start in the field by West Indies. First that non-chase and now this. This is a leg-stump half-volley. Looks like a four, but Guptill; has hit this straight and low - calf high - to Samuels at sqaure leg. He looks stunned this chance has come his way. Not awake and alert for it. Drops it
pitched up, swinging away, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, into the pads, he tickles this away for a leg-bye
full outswinger, pushed to mid-off with a straight bat
on a length, some shape away, watchfully played to cover
short and wide, not wide enough for Guptill to time the cut. Finds the fielder at point
on a length, just outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single

oh he waits. Does he want to play the big long innings? Short of a length, no room, McCullum stays back, pushes with an open face and soft hands, and hares through for a single. Oh the anticipation when McCullum takes strike. Is there any sight more exhilarating in cricket today? Normally an honour reserved for fast bowlers
drives at a wide length ball, gets a single to third man
half-volley, on off, Guptill meets is with a straight bat, and times it between mid-off and the bowler. He is excellent with these shots down the ground
this is a leg-stump half-volley. Guptill presents it the straight face again, and this time sends it crashing between the bowler and mid-on
short of a length, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
left alone outside off as this length ball swings away
short of a length, on off, McCullum defends respectfully
there goes McCullum. Jumps at Holder, Holder stays short of a length, he semi-mis-hits this to long-on
length ball, on the pads, there is a long leg in place, and he has whipped this about five yards to his left, and he still doesn't have enough time to come around

Bazullum you beauty. Holder tries the bouncer, gets it neck high, but McCullum hooks this for a flat six over square leg. It has been caught one-handed by a man in an orange shirt in the crowd. Lovely effort. He could win a share of a million dollar
short of a length, into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
short of a length again, angling in, defended by Guptill
full, just outside off, driven in the air. He is lucky this hasn't carried to mid-off

oh what a catch. The West Indies captain has risen to the occasion. This is almost like Kapil Dev running back to catch Viv Richards in the 1983 final. McCullum looks to hit this full ball over mid-off, the bat face opens in the hand, he ends up slicing it towards a very straight deep cover. Holder, guilty of a lazy chase already, goes for this. he runs hard with the eyes on the ball, he watches it drop over his shoulder, he sticks out those big levers, and he holds on to this. This is an absolute stunner. Ought to wake the side up
full outswinger, left alone
short of a length, wide, he has punched this superbly in front of square cover for four
short of a length, just outside off, leaves him against the angle, beats his defensive push
gets a wide length ball, he looks to drive hard, doesn't get any timing on the shot. The ball rolls along to point
a length ball angling in, deflected to the right of square leg. It is Guptill's call, he doesn't want one, but Williamson wants to run. Comes back in time, though
length ball outside off, he runs this down to third man for one
length ball, angling in, worked away for a single to deep square leg
short of a length, outside off, left alone
full, outside off, Williamson leans into a defensive push
short of a length, into the pad,s turned around the corner, this time Guptill calls him through for one
short of a length, defended

nearly a return catch. KW pushes at a length ball, the ball doesn't quite come on, and it goes uppishly to left of Taylor. Just too quick for him to react. Not too far from his reach but too fast for him to take it with the left hand
classy from KW. A length ball angling in, KW steps forward and drives it with a closed face, well wide of mid-on for four
short of a length, on off, KW rises with it. Defends
short of a length again, defended back to him
short of a length again, this time it is wide, gives KW the room to flash at it. Even though this has drawn an edge that goes high and wide of slip, such balls rarely get you wickets
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
length ball angling in, defended to leg
moves forward to block a length ball to short cover
on a length, holds its line outside off. He has left this one alone
wide length ball, he has driven this hard into the ground towards cover, and it bounces over short cover to go for a three
on a length, angling into the pads, nudged to square leg
short, wide, and Guptill rocks back to cut this in front of point for four
flat, into the pads, worked to square leg for one
short of a length, into the pads, nudged away for another single
half-volley on the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
stays back to defend a length ball in front of off
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for another single deep into the leg side
on a length, just outside off, watchfully blocked by KW

beautiful shot. This is as good as batting gets. Short of a length, rising towards the chest, not too wide, but he rises with it, gets both feet in the air, punches it at the top of the bounce, and between point and cover-point it goes. That was the shot that used to stand out with the young Tendulkar
gets some width, cut to point, a misifeld allows them a single
short of a length, wide, punched away to extra cover
length ball, angling in, pushed towards mid-on with soft hands. They sneak in an easy single. Mid-on caught at his heels
slower offcutter, he watches it all the way onto his defensive bat after pressing forward
short of a length, not too wide, punched away for a single
length ball, into the pads, nurdled around the corned for one
quicker one, low full toss, Guptill loves it, driving it with an open face, beating short cover in the circle to his left and deep cover to his right
fired down the leg side, and he is lucky to get away with a wide. Could have been four
defended to short straight midwicket this time
tossed up nicely, pushed back to him
flatter, into the pads, pushed straight to that short straight midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
length ball, angling in too far, clipped away to long leg for one
length ball outside off, Williamson drives, gets a thick edge. There is no slip in place anyway
bouncer from wide on the crease, he ducks under it

don't bowl short to Williamson. He is one of the best pullers and hookers New Zealand have ever produced. He rocks back, takes this from chest high, and pulls this in front of deep square leg for four
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
stays back to defend a length ball
flighted on middle and leg, solidly patted back to him
flatter, short of a length, pushed to midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, flicked away nicely, but straight to midwicket
and there is a maiden as he fires this into the pads, and the sweep goes to short fine leg
short again, this time he gets it high, and KW is not in entire control of this hook to deep square. Ends up dragging it squarer than he intends
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face to point
good short ball. Guptill is no position to face this outside off. Looks to work this to leg at the last moment, and gets a soft edge to point
this time he rides the bounce well, drops it at his feet, and responds to KW who is rushing through for a single. Applauds KW's call and his running
full, middle and off, angling in, he moves across the line to be able to clip this to long leg for one
short of a length, angling in, dropped around the corner for one
appeal for lbw as this dips and doesn't turn. Headed down leg, though
cut away for a single as he drops this in short

another appeal for lbw as this one has pitched around leg and not turned as much as expected to beat KW. West Indies have reviewed this as it is given not out. Replays show no bat involved. But I don't think this has straightened enough. And as expected, it hasn't straightened enough, and is only clipping leg. Was always going to be a wasted review
flat, into the pads, he goes and punches this to deep square leg
short of a length, into the pads, deflected around the corner for one
stays back to punch a length ball down to long-off
short of a length, wide, beautifully punched away for a single to deep cover
short of a length, around off, defended uppishly back to him
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover
good sharp bouncer, which he sways out of, but the effort of the bouncer has resulted in his overstepping
this is what KW is not good at. Premeditation. He moves across to try to hit this over leg side, and misses a full wide one completely to be hit on the pad

and against the run of the play, a soft dismissal, that too from Williamson. This is short, this is wide, doesn't look like a slower ball, but it has stopped at him. You can tell from how he ends up playing it well in front of his body. So he fails to control it, and offers a catch to short cover where Gayle takes it on the second attempt. This doesn't look like a slower ball except for the fact that it is bowled cross-seam
full, driven to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, he gets a big stride in to defend
quicker arm ball, Taylor is alert and defends
mid-on caught napping. Taylor is on nought, he is going to be looking for a quick single, but Russell is on his heels. Ramdin not happy that they have allowed him the single
tossed up wide outside off, defended off the front foot by Guptill
slower, short of a length, gets some turn from the leg-stump line. Defended back to him
defends a shortish ball outside off
wide length ball, pushed to deep cover for one
good sharp bouncer, beats the top edge on his pull
flick-pulls this with the front leg in the air as this short ball doesn't rise much
short of a length, into the body, drops this to leg for one

good running, good awareness. Digs out a yorker, makes sure it doesn't go on to hit the stumps. And then takes a single off the overthrow with there being no need to throw the stumps down. Not sure, though, if he should have been allowed to run
stays back to punch one square for a single
length ball, into the pads, helped away for one to leg
down the wicket to take a single to long-on
tossed up outside off, takes a soft outside edge
full, fast and wide, driven to deep cover for one
short, wide, Guptill stays back and frees himself up from the recent shackles with a cut between point and square cover
short of a length, wide, Taylor gets a stride in, and leaves it alone. A more confident Taylor would have crunched this away for four
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to Russell
on a length, angling in towards off, defended to mid-off
stays on a length, around the channel just outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, into the body, worked away for a single
driven to deep cover to bring up his fifty. Solid effort. Two in a row
defends one tossed up on off
too straight, flat, and Guptill places this sweep wide of short fine leg for four
defended to cover
full, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
angling into the pads, deflected to short fine leg where Samuels misfields. Not for the first time today
short and wide. They don;t need second invitations to cut these away for four
wide length ball, shaping away, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, angling, punched hard to mid-on, but they still take a single without having to rush through. Ordinary stuff in the field
full, angling in, played to short straight midwicket
short of a length, wide, pushed to short cover
short of a length, no room, but he still manages to run this down to third man for one

full ball, angling in, he looks for a powerful drive down the ground on the leg side, but gets a meaty leading edge. Lucky that mid-off is back at the fence. Had mid-off been up in the circle, this was an easy catch
short of a length, flat, into the pads, glanced away fine
flat, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched away against the turn, gets a single to deep cover
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
short and wide, poor bowling, cut away for four through point. They are getting at least one bad ball every two overs
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
full, wide, slower than usual, he ends up turning the bat face, and pinches another single to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, gets a bottom edge on the cramped cut
length ball, pushed to cover
angling in, worked away for a single to leg
driven to long-off for one
clipped away past short fine. Benn chases stiffly, but gets the big boot down in time to prevent the boundary
flat, short of a length, lucky he has found backward point
tossed up, driven hard at him, Samuels sticks one hand out to deflect it to short straight midwicket
driven down to long-on for one
defended to leg
paddled away fine of deep fine leg
wide length ball, defended to point
short of a length, outside off, runs off the thick outside edge for one
length ball, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, on the stumps, defended to leg
pushed with an open face to point
short of a length, angling in, pushed to short straight midwicket
short of a length, outside off, pushed between mid-off and cover for one
offbreak, clipped away off the pads for one
short of a length, goes back to punch it to deep cover
bunted wide of midwicket for a single
down the wicket to push this slightly wide of mid-off for one
punched down to long-on for one
driven to long-on for one
wide length ball, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
angling, worked around the corner for one
wide length ball, driven to mid-off, who is on his heels, and allows them an easy single
and they pick on Holder at mid-on again. Too many easy singles inside the ring today
pushed to leg with the angle but finds short straight midwicket
flat, outside off, opens the face late to take three runs fine of short third man. Almost from inside the gloves of Ramdin
flat, into the body, worked to leg for one
full, on off, pushed to long-on for an easy single
defended to cover
flatter, quicker, into the pads, stabbed to midwicket
worked around the corner for a single to leg
worked to leg but finds the fielder at midwicket
short of a length, angling in, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, angling in, pushed straight to short straight midwicket
on a length, just outside off, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
full, slower ball I think, pushed back to his left

that ought to break the shackles. Sammy has been bowling a tight line, but strays a little bit too far this time. Allows Guptill to close his face a little on the drive, and pierce the gap between mid-on and midwicket
angling into the pads, helped along for one
shortish, widish, cut away. Samuels gets away with it as he has hit this to point
slower, tossed up outside off, defended to cover

mis-hit. Guptill gives him the charge, not to the pitch of the ball, he seems he has holed out to long-on, but the ball doesn't carry despite a good positiver aggressive move-in by Taylor from long-on
defended to leg
driven hard but straight to mid-off
short of a length, into the pads, punched straight to midwicket
slower shortish delivery, punched down the ground. Sammy's dive causes indecision. Samuels is lazy at short midwicket. They still don't take the single. Strange
punched into the leg side again, but straight to midwicket
slower ball, wide down the leg side. Ramdin tries a stumping behind him, but the back foot is down in time
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one
Samuels misfields again. Allows an easy single at midwicket
looks for a late-cut but can't beat that man at short third man
offbreak, flighted on off, driven powerfully and straight down the ground. Powerfully enough and straight enough of long-on to get a boundary. Into the 90s now
looks to open the face from the off-stump line. Finds the man at point
short of a length, placed between midwicket and square leg. Gets a single
moves inside the line of a flat offbreak, takes a single to leg
length ball, offbreak, worked to deep midwicket for one
moves inside the line, bunts this into the leg side, comes back for a second
some movement there, takes a thick edge to the right of point. Easy single not taken. Guptill is caught ball-watching here. The ball has gone square, he should be trusting his partner's call
length ball, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
driven on the up, but straight to short cover
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-off for one
tucked away around the corner, gets a single to short fine leg
moves across the line to push this offbreak to short straight midwicket
worked to square leg for an eventually easy single
he has got it. Opens the face late to a flat delivery. Doesn;t get three. Just the couple. So he will have to wait. Pardon my excitement

there's the hundred in a WC knockout match. Drives this down to long0on. Takes off his helmet as soon as the single is completed. The capacity crowd rises to its feet. Mrs Guptill is in attendance, but it is Taylor who is hugging him. First NZer to score back-to-back WC hundreds
Taylor's first boundary as he paddles this flat delivery along to the fine-leg boundary
opens the face, can;t beat point
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, wide, but with the third man in the circle and the protection down the ground this is not a good ball. Easily back-cut away for four. Sammy not happy. Hundred for this partnership
on a length, into the pads, worked away to the man deep on the leg side
short of a length, on off, punched to cover

hugeness. Guptill is one of the sweetest hitters of the ball when he is on the front foot and driving. This is a length ball that lets him drive, and he gets under it to send it over wide long-on for an effortless biggie
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away for a single
this is not speared in, though. This is flighted on the pads, and he has swept it square, to the left of short fine leg for four
flatter, quicker, Guptill wants to cut, and it is there for the cut. Benn gets away with the extra bounce
no extra bounce this time. Similarly flat and slightly wide, allowing Guptill that late cut again. Guppers goes to the left of short third man
gets away with another poor delivery as Guptill cuts this straight to cover-point
on a length, into the pads, bunted away for a single to leg
tossed up on middle and leg, defended
short of a length, wide, punched away, but straight to cover-point
slower ball, he has seen it, and has gone with the offcut to drive it between long-on and deep midwicket. Lovely placement
yorker. Good ball, dug out back to him
on a length, on off, a mis-hit towards long-on, and they steal the second even though the fielder is Russell. Taylor might be struggling for some timing, but this aggressive second run was excellent
and that second run has put Guptill back on strike who hits this ball beautifully. Lovely awareness of the field. He has flicked this square deliberately to miss that deep midwicket fielder
superb batting. This is full and straight, there is a long-on in place, but he has drilled this straight of that man. That double hundred is so on
down the wicket to bunt this to long-on, and hand the strike over to Guptill
that's massive. Guptill is smoking them now. And a lovely clean non-violent shot. Makes a bit of room, gets under a full ball, and drives it over mid-off for a fabulous six

Taylor is run out, but he is not too angry. Guptill hasn't run the best today, but they are willing to overlook it for his excellent batting. Fired into the pads, Guptill misses on the sweep, the ball rolls towards short midwicket, Taylor sets off, but Guptill is ball-watching and sends him back. Taylor left with nowhere to go
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one to leg
tossed up outside off, flicked back to him
flat length ball, Anderson punches this straight to cover-point
short, wide, poor start. Guptill is on his two toes and cuts this over over cover-point
short of a length, on off, steers it down to third man for one
short of a length, on off, angling away, left alone
short of a length, just outside off, the attempt to open the face ends up with point
gets away with this. Length ball that pitches outside leg. He is lucky Anderson has missed out on this and is a bit early into the flick
and Anderson unleashes some power. Punches this away straight of deep point for a couple
slower through the air, he stays back, pushes it back to Benn
fired into the pads, with both fine leg and square leg up in the circle, and Guptill sweeps this for an easy four
slow, shortish, punched away to cover-point to bring up his second 150 in ODIs. Another standing ovation from the crowd as he raises his bat to them. Can he get the double hundred?
fired into the pads, flicked to short midwicket
huge wide down the leg side. Ramdin does really well to collect it
full, driven away nicely to long-on, where strangely the captain himself is fielding
he has tried to go back and pull this slightly short ball. That is because fine leg and square leg are in the circle. Doesn't connect well, and finds out short fine leg
short ball, slightly slower than Anderson expects it to be, and is beaten on the pull
another bouncer, and this time Anderson has gauged the pace right. A bit of a top edge but has gone well over the square-leg boundary
smart batting. Mid-off is up, and he just chips this length ball over that man. Too hard with these field regulations
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
yorker but the line is not good. Wide down the leg side
short of a length, punched away to deep midwicket where Carter misfields to allow them a second
yorker, just outside off, squeezed out for one
full and straight, drilled to long-on for one
full and wide, driven to extra cover, to the left of Gayle, but they don't take the single
low full toss, driven straight to long-off for one
that's clean as. This is a half-volley. Surely a yorker gone wrong? He gets under it, and drives it sweetly over mid-off for six more. Dropped in the crowd again
low full toss, nearly a yorker, dug out, the timing is off, and hence they have enough time to come back for the second
another yorker gone wrong, and he has deposited this full toss over deep midwicket. Guptill will make a superb golfer. His drives are excellent. Just the 32 needed now for the double hundred
full and wide, squeezed out straight to point. No time to take the single
slightly off pace by Russell. Yes it is a slower ball. At 123ks. Anderson shuffles across to pull this shortish ball over midwicket, but gets zero timing. Caught at midwicket off the toe end
short of a length, outside off, opens the face to guide it to the right of Ramdin for one
full and straight, can't get under this, flicked to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, steered away in front of third man, gets back for an easy second
looks to pull this bouncer, is beaten by the pace and bounce on this
full, on the pads, Guptill doesn't get all of it, but this is wide enough of deep midwicket to bring him six more. It takes him past Turner as the highest score in a WC innings by an NZer
chips this length ball over cover. Long-off is wide. Keeps them down to one
short, pulled away to deep midwicket. Charles lets it slip through his legs for three extra runs. Actually this has spun away from him at the last moment

gives him the charge, Holder slips in the bouncer, the top edge clears the keeper. because the keeper has gone chasing, and nobody is interested in coming up to the stumps to collect the throw, Guptill takes the third

for the second time Guptill has hit a six after stealing an extra run last ball and being on strike when he shouldn't be. Guptill takes this full ball, drills it over wide long-on. And his head doesn't go up to see where the ball has gone. That great Federer thing. Look at where the ball used to be a second ago. Best way of watching the ball
wide on height as the bouncer is too high
this time he goes over deep cover. Full, outside off, he is allowing him the length to get under the ball, and this time Guppers has driven with an open face. Lovely timing again
huge wide down the leg side even though the batsman might have shuffled across. Ramdin puts in another good take behind the stumps
low full toss, driven towards long-off for single
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away off the hip, Benn is stiff at long leg and this four takes Guptill to his personal best
for a moment the whole Cake Ti sighed there as Guptill pulled this in the air towards long leg. It dipped, reached there one bounce, and the Tin cheered
Elliott this time. Length ball, Elliott clears the front leg, and launches this over midwicket for a six
bouncer, he has hit it down the ground. This is ridiculous. Pulled over wide long-on for a six. And this is head high and dragged from outside off. Oh he has flatbatted it a long way
well bowled. Sees him back away and slips in a full and wide delivery to ear a dot
length ball, lucky that Guptill gets a thick inside edge for a single
quietly at the other end Elliott is playing a lovely hand. Makes room to drive this length ball over extra cover for four more

he has moved too far across to try to slog this into the leg side. He misses, draws an lbw appeal, and he has been given out lbw. They have a discussion, and then review the call. He is hit on the back leg. There is no inside edge involved here. Full, angling in, the impact is line, and he is gone. It is a tactical review gambling on the impact, but it has hit him inside the line
full toss, gets a bit big on him, takes a single to long-on
full and straight, and beautifully drilled back over his head for a one-bounce four. Lovely shot. Falls feet short of giving him the double century
pulled away to deep midwicket to reach 199. He keeps the strike

there it is, holds his arms aloft as soon as he drills this full ball to long-off. Removes the helmet, lets out a cry of joy, the whole Cake Tin bows down to his as he accepts the applause. This is a never-ending applause. Only the fifth man to get to the double hundred. First in a WC knockout match
these are no Mickey Mouse boundaries, let me assure you that. Guptill gets under a length ball and carts it over midwicket for a flat six. Big six
low full toss, midwicket is up in the circle, and he has carted this past that man for four more
watches Guptill back away and slips in a full wider delivery. A rare dot

and four more. He tries the wide full ball with all the cover fielders up for the second time in a row. This time Guptill stands his ground, which means this is within his reach, and chips this over extra cover for four
slower ball. Dangerous line. Short of a length, wide, but he beats him with the pace
full and wide with third man up. The outside edge beats the man, and the boundary brings up the highest score in a WC knockout match
Ronchi is making sure Rohit Sharma's record is safe, but New Zealand are not minding this. Length ball, and he has lofted this wide of long-on for four more
slower ball, on a length, outside off, beats his swipe across the line
full and straight, nearly a yorker, he manages to go deep into the crease to make sure he makes a clean collection, but that finds square leg on the circle
and Vettori gets into it right away. Slower length ball, he clears the front leg, and slogs this wide of long-on for four
that is an interesting shot. Full and wide, Vettori shuffles across to look for a leg-side hit, but he has toe-ended it between his legs, to the right of the wicketkeeepr. Gets four more

he has hit it out of the ground. There is no cruise liner here today otherwise some windows might have been under threat. Only the second man to hit one onto the roof of the Cake Tin. Guptill immediately gestures to Craig McMillan in the dugout, the only other man to have put one on the Tin of the Cake Tin. Full toss sent over midwicket, this is
slower bouncer, beats him
drilled down to long-on, Vettori is always coming back for two to put Guptill back on strike. And they make it
full, misses the yorkers by inches, and he has driven this with no follow through. Just over long-off for yet another six
this is just centimetres short of being a yorker. This is not a bad ball until Guptill opens the face and guides this over point for four more
there is no extra, this is full and straight, and he has dug this out towards deep midwicket where one final fumble allows them a second
